title: Channel Seven bid goodbye to Weekend Sunrise's Basil Zempilas
text:
Channel Seven bid an emotional goodbye to Basil Zempilas on Sunday.

The Weekend Sunrise presenter, 48, hosted his final episode of the show in Sydney, after 'scaling down' his role to focus on his family, who are based in Perth.

'Farewell! We hope you enjoy spending weekends with your family after two years as part of the Sunrise Family,' the network wrote on Instagram after his final episode.

Moving on! Weekend Sunrise host Basil Zempilas (R) hosted his final episode of the show on Sunday alongside Monique Wright (L) after stepping down as full time host

Basil replaced Andrew O'Keefe as co-host of the weekend breakfast show in March 2018, and has become a fan favourite alongside Monique Wright ever since.

In a statement on Friday, Basil said: 'Co-hosting Weekend Sunrise has been one of my career highlights. I've loved every minute of the last two years.

'I won't be lost to the Sunrise family; I plan to be back as a visitor. But for now, my family, commitments in Perth and Tokyo 2020 Olympics with Seven are my focus.'

'We hope you enjoy spending weekends with your family after two years as part of the Sunrise Family,' Seven said on Instagram after his final episode aired. Pictured: Monique and Basil with co-hosts Sally Bowrey and Simon Reeve

Since March 2018, Basil has been flying to Sydney each weekend for Weekend Sunrise, while presenting weeknight sport reports for Seven News in Perth.

Alongside his commitments for the network, he also has a top-rated breakfast radio show with Steve Mills on 6PR each weekday morning in Western Australia.

In February, the father-of-three revealed the constant travelling across Australia has been difficult for his family.

Moving on! Barry has 'scaled down his role' on Weekend Sunrise to focus on his family in Perth

Busy man! Since last March, Basil has been flying to Sydney each weekend for Weekend Sunrise, while presenting weeknight sports for Seven and a breakfast radio show in Perth. Pictured: Basil with his daughter on Weekend Sunrise

'There's no doubt that [my wife] Amy and my family, the three kids have sacrificed a lot for my career, all of it I suppose,' he told The West Australian.

'All of my children have been born in the time that I have been travelling away interstate. I'm very aware had it not been for their support and flexibility I wouldn't be able to do the things that I'm doing.'
description: Channel Seven bid an emotional goodbye to Basil Zempilas on Sunday.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
